body_html: I changed -D__thread=thread_local \ to -D__thread= \ in tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile (for the i386 architecture only) and that's an okay workaround for now. It (probably) re-introduces the problem that #12573 solved for that architecture, but at least for my use that's acceptable until this gets a proper solution.
body_text: I changed -D__thread=thread_local \ to -D__thread= \ in tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile (for the i386 architecture only) and that's an okay workaround for now. It (probably) re-introduces the problem that #12573 solved for that architecture, but at least for my use that's acceptable until this gets a proper solution.
body: I changed `-D__thread=thread_local \` to `-D__thread= \` in tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile (for the `i386` architecture only) and that's an okay workaround for now. It (probably) re-introduces the problem that #12573 solved for that architecture, but at least for my use that's acceptable until this gets a proper solution.
